title: Abu Qatada arrest over 'bail breach'
description: Radical cleric Abu Qatada is arrested for allegedly breaching bail conditions, days ahead of the government's latest attempt to deport him.

title: Kenya count 'gives Kenyatta victory'
description: Provisional results give Kenya's Deputy PM Uhuru Kenyatta victory in the presidential poll, but rival Raila Odinga is expected to file a challenge.

title: Van Dyck painting 'found online'
description: A portrait is attributed to 17th Century master Anthony Van Dyck and valued at up to £1m after being spotted on the BBC Your Paintings website.

title: Court upholds Egypt death sentences
description: A court in Egypt upholds 21 death sentences over deadly 2012 football riots in Port Said, amid continuing tensions over the trial.

title: Sign error may mean speeding let-off
description: Thousands of motorway speeding convictions could be overturned because the font used on some traffic signs may have failed to meet regulations.

title: Deadly bomb attack on Kabul ministry
description: At least nine people die as a suicide bomber attacks the Afghan defence ministry in Kabul, during a visit to the city by the new US Pentagon chief.

title: Cable warning over spending cuts
description: Serious damage will be done to industry if only some government departments have to make cuts in spending, Business Secretary Vince Cable warns.

title: Venezuela swears in acting president
description: Venezuela's former vice-president Nicolas Maduro is sworn in as acting president hours after the state funeral of Hugo Chavez.

title: Researchers grow teeth from cells
description: Dentists could one day be able to replace missing teeth with ones newly grown from gum cells, say British researchers.

title: Five police officers hurt in riot
description: Five police officers have been injured and offices have been damaged during rioting in Newtownabbey, County Antrim.

title: 'World's top' eatery sickens dozens
description: More than 60 people suffered food poisoning at a Danish restaurant described as the world's best eatery, it has emerged.

title: New theory over Stonehenge building
description: Thousands of people came from across Britain to help build Stonehenge, experts investigating the origins of the monument say.

title: Mind the Gap returns after wife plea
description: A 40-year-old "mind the gap" recording once heard across the Tube will return to one station - so the widow of the actor behind it can hear his voice.

title: Dog TV launched for home alone pets
description: An Israeli TV company has launched a channel just for dogs called Dog TV.

title: Compton and Cook lead fightback
description: Nick Compton scores his first Test century and Alastair Cook his 24th as England reduce New Zealand's lead to 59 in the first Test.

title: Official banned for life by RFU
description: Ex-London Welsh team boss Mike Scott receives a life ban from rugby union for his role in the fielding of an ineligible player.

title: Woods moves in front of McDowell
description: Tiger Woods moves into a two-shot lead over Northern Ireland's Graeme McDowell at the World Golf Championships event in Miami.

title: Jenkins happy to beat Scots 3-0
description: Assistant coach Neil Jenkins would be happy for Wales to beat Scotland 3-0 to keep their Six Nations title hopes alive.

title: Sharapova through at Indian Wells
description: Second seed Maria Sharapova picks up a comfortable 6-2 6-1 win over Francesca Schiavone in the second round at Indian Wells.

title: More than 500 bankers paid £1m-plus
description: A total of 428 employees at Barclays and 93 at RBS earn more than £1m last year, the banks disclose.

title: US labour market shows strong rise
description: The US economy added 236,000 jobs in February, while the jobless rate eased to 7.7%, lifting hopes for a sustainable recovery.

title: Watchdog contradicts PM on growth
description: David Cameron is involved in a dispute with the Office for Budget Responsibility about the impact of austerity measures on economic growth.

title: Clegg says Lib Dems let people down
description: The Liberal Democrats "let people down" by not dealing with claims made against the party's ex-chief executive, Nick Clegg tells party delegates.

title: Pryce guilty over Huhne points swap
description: Vicky Pryce, the former wife of ex-MP Chris Huhne, is found guilty of perverting the course of justice by taking speeding points on his behalf 10 years ago.

title: Man held after fatal bus stabbing
description: A man is arrested after a 16-year-old girl was stabbed to death on a rush-hour bus on one of Birmingham's busiest roads.

title: Processed meat 'early death' link
description: Sausages, ham, bacon and other processed meats appear to increase the risk of dying young, a study of half a million people across Europe suggests.

title: UN backs tough new N Korea sanctions
description: The UN Security Council unanimously approves fresh sanctions against North Korea in response to Pyongyang's nuclear test last month.

title: UK smoking 'halves' in 40 years
description: Smoking in Britain has more than halved and people are drinking on fewer nights of the week, according to a snapshot survey covering the past 40 years.

title: Ex-detective in Pistorius case quits
description: The ex-lead detective in the Oscar Pistorius case, who faces separate charges of attempted murder, has resigned, South African police say.

title: No alternative on economy, says PM
description: Changing course on the economy would plunge the UK 'back into the abyss', the PM warns - after Vince Cable suggests spending may have to rise.

title: Sugar 'no intention' of paying out
description: Lord Sugar has 'no intention' of paying out to Apprentice winner Stella English 'unless instructed to do so', he tells a tribunal.

title: Berlusconi convicted over wiretap
description: Italy's former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi is convicted and sentenced to a year in jail over an illegal wiretap.

title: Graduate pay gap - women paid less
description: Female graduates are still likely to earn thousands of pounds less than men, according to a new report.

title: BoE rejects more economic stimulus
description: The Bank of England's rate-setting committee has kept interest rates at 0.5% and rejected calls to inject more stimulus into the economy.

title: Frozen phones give up data secrets
description: Putting an Android phone in a freezer for an hour can help get at its confidential contents, find German security researchers.
